definitions.definition: A long seat with or without a back, found for example in parks and schools.
definitions.example: They sat on a park bench and tossed bread crumbs to the ducks and pigeons.

definitions.definition: The people who decide on the verdict; the judiciary.
definitions.example: They are awaiting a decision on the motion from the bench.

definitions.definition: The place where the judges sit.
definitions.example: She sat on the bench for 30 years before she retired.

definitions.definition: The dignity of holding an official seat.
The place where players (substitutes) and coaches sit when not playing.
definitions.example: He spent the first three games on the bench, watching.

definitions.definition: The number of players on a team able to participate, expressed in terms of length.
A place where assembly or hand work is performed; a workbench.
definitions.example: She placed the workpiece on the bench, inspected it closely, and opened the cover.

definitions.definition: A horizontal padded surface, usually adjustable in height and inclination and often with attached weight rack, used for proper posture during exercise.
A bracket used to mount land surveying equipment onto a stone or a wall.
definitions.example: After removing the bench, we can use the mark left on the wall as a reference point.

definitions.definition: A flat ledge in the slope of an earthwork, work of masonry, or similar.
A thin strip of relatively flat land bounded by steeper slopes above and below.
A kitchen surface on which to prepare food, a counter.
A bathroom surface which holds the washbasin, a vanity.
A collection or group of dogs exhibited to the public, traditionally on benches or raised platforms.
To remove a player from play.
definitions.example: They benched him for the rest of the game because they thought he was injured.

definitions.definition: To remove someone from a position of responsibility temporarily.
To push a person backward against a conspirator behind them who is on their hands and knees, causing them to fall over.
To furnish with benches.
To place on a bench or seat of honour.
The weight one is able to bench press, especially the maximum weight capable of being pressed.
definitions.example: He became frustrated when his bench increased by only 10 pounds despite a month of training.

definitions.definition: To lift by bench pressing
definitions.example: I heard he can bench 150 pounds.

definitions.definition: To recite the Birkat Hamazon.
